Package monkey.mnk

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • monkey.mnk.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, State<Board,​Position>
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements State<Board,​Position>
    A Board describes the State of a m,n,k-game. It supports backtracking, alpha-beta pruning, pattern search, and more. A single istance of this class takes Î˜(SIZE) memory.
    Since:
    1.0

      • actions

        public java.util.Iterator<Position> actions()
        Defines the set of legal Actions, excluding the irrelevant ones.
        Takes Î˜(1) time in the best and average cases, but Î˜(SIZE} in the worst case. The act of instantiating an iterator and bringing it to the end of the sequence always takes Î˜(SIZE) time in total.
        Specified by:
        actions in interface State<Board,​Position>
        Returns:
        An Iterator containing the legal Actions for the state.

      • eval

        public int eval​(Player p)
        Returns an estimate of the expected utility of the game from the current State for a certain Player. It is implemented as a simplified (see project report) version of the heuristic of Abdoulaye-Houndji-Ezin-Aglin. The coefficients are left as unnamed constants because of their large number and their experimental origin. See A. Abdoulaye, V. R. Houndji, E. C. Ezin, G. Aglin, Generic Heuristic for the mnk-games, in A. E. Badouel, N. Gmati, B. Watson (eds), Proceedings of CARI 2018 (African Conference on Research in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics). Nabil Gmati; Eric Badouel; Bruce Watson. CARI 2018 - Colloque africain sur la recherche en informatique et mathÃ©matiques appliquÃ©es, Oct 2018, Stellenbosch, South Africa. 2018, pp. 268-269. hal-01881376f.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface State<Board,​Position>
        Parameters:
        p - The Player from whose point of view the current Board is evaluated.
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        State.utility(monkey.ai.Player)

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value for the object. Zobrist hashing is used (transpositions and symmetric Boards will return the same hash code).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A hash code value for this object.
        Since:
        1.0

      • theoreticalGameValue

        protected java.lang.Integer theoreticalGameValue()
        Computes the theoretical game value of the current configuration looking it up in a small knowledge base. See J.W.H.M. Uiterwijk, H.J. van den Herik, The advantage of the initiative, Information Sciences, Volume 122, Issue 1, 2000, p. 46f.
        Returns:
        The theoretical game value, or null if it is unknown.
        Since:
        1.0

      • generateActionCandidates

        protected Position[] generateActionCandidates()
        Generates a sequence containing all of the Positions of this Board, sorted by decreasing heuristic value. Escargot heuristic is used (see the project report). Takes Î˜(SIZE) time.
        Returns:
        The generated sequence.
        Since:
        1.0

      • countThreats

        protected int countThreats​(int length,
                           Threat type,
                           Player threatener)
        Retrieves the number of Threats stored by this object, filtered by length, type, and threatener.
        Parameters:
        length - Length of the Threats to count.
        type - Nature of the Threats to count.
        threatener - Player doing the threatening.
        Returns:
        The current number of the Threats queried.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Type or threatener are null and required to compute the result.
        Since:
        1.0
